FOR PEOPLE COMPLAINING ABOUT 2 FILES:
if you're watching on your pc, you can add both files into VLC to play them back-to-back which is the same as 1 file... you don't have to get up and start the next file or anything:
just start vlc, select both files, drag into vlc. part 2 will auto play after part 1.

So what if the movie is in two parts? Just use MEncoder.

mencoder -oac copy -ovc copy -forceidx ./moviecd1.avi ./moviecd2.avi -o CombinedAvi.avi

For you Windows freaks, use Movie Maker if you can stand using such a buggy piece of crap that is.

Just a warning, I live on campus and just got an email from my university telling me that they know I've been using file sharing services and if I continue, my internet will be cut off. I read the email further and it turns out that Alliance films actually emailed the university informing them that I downloaded this movie and another (Looper) and asked for them to store my information in case they wish to charge me. 

Just be sure to use proxies to cover you ass for this one. I've been getting a little lax lately.
